item.description:
Karl from Slow Food Portland cordially invites members of Portland Maine Permaculture to attend SFP's potluck this supper (which will include guests of special interest to our group!):

---------------------------

Hi All,

Just a reminder that we have a Slow Food Portland Potluck and Meeting next Wednesday!

Our special guests on Wednesday will be Nick Runkle and Justin Cutter from the Compass Green Mobile Greenhouse project.

http://www.compassgreenproject.org/

Compass Green is a fully functional greenhouse built in the back of a  box truck that grows vegetables and herbs and is powered by waste vegetable oil. They teach practical farming tools and raise awareness on sustainability through presentations, workshops, and greenhouse tours.

They will be talking about their project and giving tours of the 
mobile greenhouse, which we hope to have parked right in front of Quimby Colony.

We will also be talking about our plans for the $5 meal Slow Food Day of Action, which will take place on Sept. 17.

We discovered last month that while beautiful kitchen at Quimby 
Colony has lots of plates and glasses, there is a definite lack of 
serving and eating ware, so I highly recommend everyone bring their own eating "kit" or at least a fork or spoon, and whatever serving  utensils you need for your dish.

We had an amazing potluck last month with the likes of seared tuna, and amazing salads and cheese. Let's see if we can top it this month.


RSVP here or email  karl@tenapplefarm.com, so we can have a rough head count.

Looking forward to seeing you there!

Best,

Karl

Karl Schatz
Ten Apple Farm
241 Yarmouth Rd
Gray, Maine 04039
207-657-7880
http://www.tenapplefarm.com

group.name: Portland Maine Permaculture & The Resilience Hub

item.name: Slow Food Portland Potluck w/Compass Green Mobile Greenhouse
